Therefore, reject Parent_E again to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C admissions team,

Thank you for considering my earlier applications. I noticed Nursery_C is still available this round, and I wanted to ask if there is any specific eligibility detail, documentation, or timing requirement that is currently preventing my acceptance.

Nursery_C remains my first choice, and if a place is available I can confirm immediately and complete all paperwork the same day. I’m also flexible on start date and arrangements.

If you can share what would be needed for me to be considered (or whether I should re-submit a formal application this round), I will respond right away.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. However, I have been rejected multiple times, likely because other higher-priority parents (Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D) are competing. Since Nursery_C is still unmatched in round 6, there may be a vacancy or uncertainty; a softer [TALK] message can elicit whether any condition/document could improve my standing or whether a place might open imminently, without wasting an [APPLY] that could be immediately rejected again. I will ask directly what would be needed to be considered and reiterate immediate acceptance and flexibility.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C. There isn’t a missing document or a timing issue on your side—our decisions are based on our priority order and the pool of families engaging with us in each round.

If you would like to be actively considered in the current round, please feel free to submit a formal application again with an [APPLY] message. If a place cannot be offered, it would be due to higher-priority applicants being considered for our single available place, rather than any specific eligibility detail you have not provided.

Kind regards,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]
